text: yā̐hāra prasāde bhāi    e bhava tariyā yāi
translation: I carefully offer my obeisance to Śrī Guru’s lotus feet, which are the sole abode of devotion. O brother! By his mercy we cross over this world and reach Kṛṣṇa.

text: śrī guru-charaṇe rati    ei se uttama-gati
translation: Make the teachings from Śrī Guru’s lotus mouth one with your heart, and do not desire anything else within your heart. Attachment to Śrī Guru’s feet is the best path. By his mercy all desires are fulfilled.

text: chakṣu-dāna dilā yei    janme janme prabhu sei
prema-bhakti yā̐hā haite    avidyā vināśa yāte
translation: He who gave me the gift of eyes is my lord, birth after birth. He manifested divine knowledge in my heart. He gives prema-bhakti and destroys ignorance. The Vedas sing of his character.

text: hā hā prabhu kara dayā    deha more pada-chhāyā
translation: Śrī Guru is an ocean of mercy and the friend of the fallen. He is the lord and life of all people. O master! Be merciful. Give me the shade of your feet. This fallen soul has taken shelter of you.

I have taken shelter. I have taken shelter at your lotus feet, where there is no fear. Please be merciful to me. O Śrī Gurudev, saviour of the fallen, please be merciful to me. Understanding that I am lowly and fallen, be merciful to me. All glory to you, Śrī Gurudev!
